Detailed Description

Building HTML objects.

Description

This class can be used for generating HTML objects, such as tables that would otherwise be time consuming.

cmhtml_example

Example 1: Building a table from a database query: 

 $dbh = new CMMySQL("mysql://root:abc123@localhost/test");
 echo CMHTML::Table(array(
   'header' => array('ID', 'First name', 'Last name'),
   'data' => $dbh->query("select * from dummy")
 ));
Author:
Elliot Chance

Definition at line 26 of file CMHTML.php.

Member Function Documentation

static Table ( $  a  )  [static]

Build a HTML table.

All of the provided attributes can be database query handles, but it's important to note that the query handle will be converted into an array - but unless it is needed as an array it will take the first element as the value. For example: 

 echo CMHTML::Table(array(
   'cellspacing' => $dbh->query("select tablespacing, name from mytable limit 3")
 ));

As cellspacing is not recognised in the table below it is assumed to be a single value attribute for the <table> tag, so the output may look something like this: 

 <table cellspacing="5">
   ...
 </table>
Parameters:
$a Attributes Any attribute provided that is not listed in the table below will be added as an attribute to the <table> tag - examples include cellpadding, style etc.

Name Description
data Can be a 2 dimentional array, or a database query handle.
header An array, or a database query handle.
